Your Role: Provide entry and/or junior level field and technical support on environmental assessment, investigation, and remediation projects, primarily in the areas related to geology, hydrogeology, and data interpretation/ visualization. Under general supervision, plans, conducts, and supervises tasks such as fieldwork, sampling, design, construction oversight, operations, and maintenance (O&M), and report writing on environmental and engineering projects. Performs projects in accordance with RCRA, CERCLA, UST, CWA and other appropriate state and federal regulations. Reviews progress and evaluates results. Interprets and applies organization policy. Reviews progress with management. Prepares, develops, and assists in the preparation of proposals and qualification statements. Candidate must be a U.S. Citizen due to the service we provide our client. Responsibilities: This position will have both field and non-field related responsibilities. Field work planning and preparation, drilling and monitoring well installation oversight, logging boreholes, remedial system (e.g., subsurface injections) implementation and operation and maintenance, and report preparation. Field work will also include collection, and proper documentation of environmental sampling. Perform assessment, investigative, and remedial fieldwork that typically includes testing and sampling of soils, groundwater, and other media. Preparation of work plans and sampling and analysis plans, drilling specifications, environmental assessment and investigation reports, and other technical documents. May perform a range of tasks requiring advanced scientific, geologic, and engineering analytical techniques, including interpretation of hydrogeologic settings impacted by contamination. Other duties may be assigned as determined appropriate by the supervisor based on client’s needs and candidate’s level of experience. Assume supporting roles in cost proposals and marketing.
